description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4j0k7","text":"This is an adaptation of protocol https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bij8kcrw in which initial the initial DNA concentration and library prep reagent volumes have been reduced to a quarter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u5os","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3scs","text":"(The last step in this version contains a supplemental video with extra context and tips, as part of the protocols.io Spotlight series, featuring conversations with protocol authors.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"84D844F0B93311ED9481FDC1CD6DEF8B","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/iseq-bacterial-wgs-protocol-using-a-quarter-of-the-cqe2vtge?step=194"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6fnr7","text":"Wear gloves and change gloves often to avoid cross contamination. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3cb0m","text":"Consider using separate laboratory coats and disposable sleeve covers for bacterial propagation, DNA extraction, and library preparation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3mfjm","text":"Be sure to use clean, aerosol resistant pipette tips for addition of reagents to samples and in between samples to avoid cross-contamination.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8ol5","text":"Frozen isolates should be sub-cultured on Trypticase Soy + 5% Sheep Blood Agar plates (BAPs) or equivalent media. If the culture appears pure, pick an isolated colony, and streak it on a fresh BAP; incubate at 35°C overnight (24±2 hours) in aerobic conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73vuu","text":"DNA extraction may be performed either from a colony from the second BAP or from an overnight liquid culture pellet from that colony.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5j30d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"89uio","text":"From broth: Transfer 1-1.5 mL of culture to a labelled microcentrifuge tube and centrifuge at 5,000 g for 10 minutes. Remove the supernatant and store the pellet in the tube at -20°C until DNA is extracted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4722h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dpcqc","text":"Direct from colony: (when ready to proceed directly with extraction) from bacterial colonies on plate, fill out a 1 μL loop with overnight growth and add to a labelled microcentrifuge tube containing the appropriate extraction buffer for gram positive or gram negative bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"88ppf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"nhcb","text":"For Gram Positive bacteria, proceed to step 4. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1op54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2c2up","text":"For Gram Negative bacteria, proceed to step 9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dg9pa","text":"Gram Postive Bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ep19l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9t4md","text":"From broth: Add 180 μL of prepared enzymatic lysis (ELB)-lysozyme mixture to the tube and resuspend the pellet. Proceed to step 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2bpcg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"855kt","text":"From colony: Add overnight growth directly to 180 μL of prepared enzymatic lysis (ELB)-lysozyme mixture to the tube and resuspend the pellet. Proceed to step 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"degtj","text":"Incubate at 56°C for 30 minutes, vortexing periodically.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ac44","text":"Optional: Add 4 μL of RNase A to each tube, vortex and then incubate at RT for 3-5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"drlor","text":"Add 25 μL Proteinase K and 200 μL Buffer AL to the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vnpq","text":"Mix thoroughly by vortexing, and incubate at 56°C for 30 minutes. Proceed to step 14.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h2tn","text":"Gram Negative Bacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a6b5h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7tuu4","text":"If the ATL buffer solution is cloudy and has precipitate formation, be sure to heat the solution at 50 - 55°C until solution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7g6de","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6co8m","text":"From broth: Add 180 μL Buffer ATL to the tube and resuspend the pellet. Add 20 μL Proteinase K to the tube, then vortex. Proceed to step 10.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1s2s7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fh5oc","text":"From colony: Add overnight growth directly to 180 μL Buffer ATL to the tube and resuspend the pellet. Add 20 μL Buffer proteinase K to the tube, then vortex. Proceed to step 10.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amf1k","text":"Incubate at 56°C for a minimum of 1 hour or up to overnight, vortexing periodically.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0l03","text":"Optional: Add 4 μL of RNase A to each tube, vortex and then incubate at RT for 3-5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aq4jt","text":"Add 200 μL Buffer AL to the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n9uu","text":"Mix thoroughly by vortexing, and incubate at 56°C for 10 minutes. Proceed to step 14.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mqau","text":"Add 200 μL ethanol (200 proof) to each tube and mix thoroughly by vortexing followed by a brief pulse spin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8h43","text":"Pipet the mixture from step 14 into a labelled DNeasy Mini spin column. Centrifuge at 6,000xg for 1 minute. Discard flow-through and the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l9hv","text":"Add 500 μL Buffer AW1, and centrifuge for 1 minute at 6,000xg (8,000rpm). Discard the flow-through and the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpput","text":"Add 500 μL Buffer AW2, and centrifuge for 1 minute at 6,000xg (8,000rpm). Discard the flow-through and the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"an66t","text":"Transfer the spin column to a new collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"29i2g","text":"Centrifuge for 1 minute at 18,000-20,000xg (14,000rpm) to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsm1i","text":"Place the spin column in a clean, labelled 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube, and pipet 100 μL Buffer EB directly onto the DNeasy membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61g4f","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 1 minute, and then centrifuge for 1 minute at 18,000-20,000xg (14,000rpm) to elute. Record which speed used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ai0r7","text":"Discard spin column and store DNA sample at 4°C for up to 48 hours. For long term storage (\u003e48 hours), store DNA sample at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7115d","text":"DNA quantification using the Qubit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7mftv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ciqhe","text":"The following protocol is for 4 samples. If needed, scale the volumes down or up depending on the sample number. The DNA input necessary for this procedure is \u003e100ng. However, an input larger than 500ng is not recommended. Therefore, quantification is a recommended step to ensure proper amount of DNA is added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3krbe","text":"Download the   and fill in the isolate identifiers in column B. The blue boxes in the workbook should be filled in while following this protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"b1ric","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"6799C5507EA011EBB4EB01A727819D5A","id":93955,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"iSeq_Prep-Salm-Workbook-public.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/c52dbbspx.xlsx"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fdokk","text":"Wear gloves to keep sides of reagent tubes clean and to protect yourself from the reagents. Remove components of Qubit dsDNA BR Assay Kit stored at 4°C and ensure they are at room temperature before use. Be sure to vortex and pulse spin the standards and reagent dye.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tik4","text":"Prepare the Qubit working solution by diluting 7 μL Qubit dsDNA BR Reagent 200X in 1393 μL Qubit dsDNA BR Buffer in a clean, low-bind plastic tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6huis","text":"Label the tops of Qubit assay tubes to correspond to sample label and BR dsDNA standard label. Do not label the tube sides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kptr","text":"Add 190 μL of Qubit working solution to each of the Qubit assay tubes used for Standard #1 and #2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fttok","text":"Add 196 μL Qubit working solution to individual Qubit assay tubes used for each sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd40p","text":"Add 10 μL of each Qubit Standard to the appropriate standard tube, and add 4 μL DNA sample to sample tubes, then mix by vortexing. Briefly pulse spin to assure there are no bubbles present. Note: the input range for the Qubit platform is 1-20 μL, and the volume can be adjusted if desired (as long as the final volume is 200 μL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":190,"length":139}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9cqs","text":"Allow all tubes to incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes. Avoid unnecessary handling of tubes as transfer of heat from your hands may lower the reading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n6vv","text":"On the Home screen of the Qubit 2.0/3.0/4.0 Fluorometer, press DNA, then select dsDNA Broad Range as the assay type. The “Standards” screen is displayed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4pvkr","text":"On the Standards screen, press Yes to read the standards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7t3ot","text":"Insert the tube containing Standard #1 into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read. When the reading is complete, remove Standard #1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjiml","text":"Insert the tube containing Standard #2 into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read. When the reading is complete, remove Standard #2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6lcju","text":"Select 4 µL for Volume of Sample and insert a sample tube into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read. When the reading is complete, record the calculated stock concentration. Then remove the sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bdvhd","text":"Repeat reading until all samples have been read.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi2ek","text":"Record the Qubit readings in the Initial Dilution tab, Column I, DNA Concentration, of the DNA Prep workbook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c4kvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5scad","text":"DNA quantification and/or quality check using NanoDrop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e15jv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a20v4","text":"     Equipment, Kit, and Reagent      Components      Amount per sample      Amount for 4 samples + 2 standards and +1 extra      Initials        NanoDrop (ThermalFisher)      NA      NA      NA          ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":204}],"data":[]},{"key":"6bfrb","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[155,125,155,100],"data":[["Equipment, Kit, and Reagent","Components","Amount per Sample","Amount for 4 Samples + 2 Standards and +1 extra"],["NanoDrop (ThermoFisher)","  NA  ","  NA  ","  NA  "]],"guid":"991DEA9CD65E11EAA90A0A58A9FEAC2A","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"as63h","text":"This step is optional but recommended for first time users.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Equipment, Kit, and Reagent","Components","Amount per Sample","Amount for 4 Samples + 2 Standards and +1 extra"],["NanoDrop (ThermoFisher)","  NA  ","  NA  ","  NA  "]],"rowHeights":[23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7duv","text":"Select Nucleic Acid assay on computer or touchscreen interface of NanoDrop. You may need to do further selection to find the assay specifically for dsDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29lr1","text":"Clean the upper and lower pedestals of the sample loading area with a laboratory wipe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fipn","text":"Select Nucleic Acid assay on computer or touchscreen interface of NanoDrop. You may need to do further selection to find the assay specifically for dsDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87ddq","text":"Load 2 μL water on the lower pedestal and close the upper arm gently. Click “Initiate”. Wipe off water on the lower and upper pedestals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9939p","text":"Load 2 μL EB on the lower pedestal and close the upper arm gently. Click “Blank”. Wipe off water on the lower and upper pedestals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bpkq6","text":"Load 2 μL of sample on the lower pedestal and close the upper arm gently. Click “Measure”. Record concentration, 260/280, and 260/230. When recording concentration, make sure dsDNA assay is used. Wipe off water on the lower and upper pedestals. Load the next sample for test. It is not necessary to clean with water between sample tests.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b885e","text":"Record the NanoDrop concentration readings in the Initial Dilution tab, Column H, DNA Concentration, of the DNAFlex workbook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ang51","text":"Record the 260/280 and 260/230 ratios in Columns F and G, Initial Dilution tab, of the DNA Flex Workbook. Refer to the Illumina DNA Prep guide for recommended ratios.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38gvn","text":"Clean both upper and lower pedestals of sample loading area with water and laboratory wipes. Close the upper arm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ndqb","text":"Preparation of Sample Sheet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dr3sd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54s2j","text":"The steps for Sample Plate and Sample Sheet setup in the Illumina Experiment Manager on the instrument can be completed at any point in this protocol but must be performed prior to the start of the run. However, it is recommended to create the Sample Plate and Sample Sheet at the beginning of library prep. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e3hb","text":"Depending upon desired sample throughput, the samples can be prepped using individual tubes with a magnetic stand device equipped to handle tubes. Alternatively, samples can be prepped using a 96-well format with a magnetic device that handle plates. A 96-well format lends itself for using a multi-channel pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hoev","text":"Prepare the \"Initial dilution\" tab from the \"DNA Flex Workbook\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"201fb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4unhl","text":"NOTE: The workbook is designed with the following color scheme, in general, the blue colored fields should be filled in.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":114}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdqc2","text":"Confirm or adjust the i7 and i5 indexes listed in Columns D and E. If using indexes purchased in the 96-well plate format, choose positions on the Nextera CD indexes map and note the wells used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":147,"length":22}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D0B46820E89411EBAA5AB526AA1FA777","url":"https://support-docs.illumina.com/SHARE/IndexAdapterPooling/Content/SHARE/IndexAdapterPooling/Nextera/CDIndexes_96-samples_fNXT.htm"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37clq","text":"Check that the DNA input (ng) is ~75 ng in Column J. If it is below this range, adjust the volume multiplier (change the 2 to a higher number) in the Column J formula so that it falls in this range.  If the original concentration falls above range (DNA is too concentrated), perform a dilution, re-check the concentration, and update row I.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":150,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":199,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b3h28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"da9au","text":"NOTE: We adjusted the concentration of the DNA input to 10ng/μL and we used 7.5 μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":4,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cmtr","text":"Add enough nuclease-free water calculated in Column L of the \"DNA Flex Workbook\" to each sample in a clean PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0g4u","text":"Add volume of DNA adjusted in Column K of the \"DNA Flex Workbook\" to the sample tubes now containing nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4hbqp","text":"Mix by pitetting 5-10 times. Close tubes (or seal plate) and store at 4-8º C overnight, or proceed to step 59.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cmvd","text":"Tagment Genomic DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"51j2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bigg6","text":"Remove the SPB, TSB, and TWB from Box 1 and bring to room temperature. The TSB and TWB can then be stored at room temperature. Remove one tube of BLT from Box 3 and bring to room temperature. Thaw the RSB, bring TB1 (from freezer) to room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"befru","text":"Vortex BLT vigorously for 10 seconds, visually check the beads for complete resuspension and repeat as necessary. Vortex the TB1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3njj0","text":"Prepare the tagmentation master mix according to the following table:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"410pe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6v7lc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2nit8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[156,231,50],"data":[["Reagent","Volume per Sample","For 4 Samples"],["TB1","2.5 µL","10 µL"],["BLT","2.5 µL","10 µL"]],"guid":"884AA300D81F11EABCA3F7CC310C481A","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d4rml","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Reagent","Volume per Sample","For 4 Samples"],["TB1","2.5 µL","10 µL"],["BLT","2.5 µL","10 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39eu0","text":"Vortex the Tagmentation master mix thoroughly to make sure the BLT beads are evenly resuspended in the buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co789","text":"Using fresh tips, transfer 5 µL of Tagmentation master mix to each well containing a sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qmek","text":"Pipette up and down 10 times mixing the 12.5 µL reaction to resuspend the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7o9dm","text":"Close the PCR tube (or seal the plate with Microseal 'A' or equivalent if using a 96-well format).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29nej","text":"Place the PCR tubes into the thermalcycler and run the tagmentation program FLEXTAG. If the thermalcycler does not have the program, create one using the following conditions with a lid pre-heated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eu9av","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ed16l","text":"Incubation Conditions: (12.5 µL total reaction)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43t68","text":"1.   55°C for 15 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2virh","text":"2.   Hold at 10°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"et96d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"57h52","text":"Upon completion of the incubation, remove the PCR tubes from the thermalcycler and proceed to Post Tagmentation Cleanup steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"641ej","text":"Post Tagmentation Cleanup. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f5t44","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e8236","text":"Check for precipitates in the TSB. If present, heat the buffer at 37°C for 10 minutes and vortex until dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1te1p","text":"Open the PCR tubes (or remove the seal from plate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nm0p","text":"If PCR tubes (or plate) were retrieved from cold storage, centrifuge at 280 x g for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9b9js","text":"Place the tubes on the magnet for 3-5 minutes (until supernatant is clear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beljf","text":"Transfer 10 µL of the PCR supernatant (now containing DNA)  to clean tubes (or a different location on the sample plate or into a fresh 96-well plate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":36},{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d7poe","text":"Remove the tubes from magnet and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4i9ap","text":"Vortex and then add 21.25 µL of the SPB master mix prepared in step 102, to each well. Be sure to not carry over extra SPB master mix on the outside of the tips. Wipe the outside of the tips on the reservoir to remove droplets before transferring the SPB master mix to the PCR supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":87,"length":202}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5t2s8","text":"Pipette to mix a minimum of 10 times until thoroughly mixed (use caution as volume is \u003e 100 µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1qa9r","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fknkt","text":"Place tubes on the magnet for 5 minutes or until supernatant is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1h4v2","text":"During the incubation, vortex the SPB stock tube thoroughly, and add 3.75 µL to new tubes (one for each sample) (or on the same plate or in a new 96-well plate). Be sure to remove excess SPB from the outside of tips before addition to new tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":162,"length":83}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nq9h","text":"Transfer 31.25 µL of supernatant  to the wells containing the 3.75 µLSPB (stock concentration).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl927","text":"Gently pipette to mix 10 times at a volume of ~85 µL, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9g37a","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ak8bv","text":"Place the tubes on the magnet for 5 minutes or until clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"68e2s","text":"Remove and discard the supernatant without disrupting the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59sl2","text":"With the tubes on the magnet, add 180 µL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol and incubate for 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dpgu6","text":"Pipette to remove the ethanol supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8qi75","text":"Repeat steps 118 and 119 for a total of two washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7oe89","text":"Use a pipette to remove any excess liquid from tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dm6q5","text":"Leave beads to air dry on the magnet for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dkr41","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnet and add 32 µLof RSB to the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5qh31","text":"Pipette to mix until thoroughly resuspended.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"26r6a","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 2-5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"avfn4","text":"Place the tubes onto the magnet for 3 minutes until clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kp1m","text":"Transfer 30 µL of the supernatant into a new tube for each sample (or new well on a 96-well plate for each sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c2okb","text":"If ready, continue to the Pooling Libraries step. Otherwise, this is a safe stopping point. Close the tubes (or seal the plate with a freezer-safe seal) and store at -20°C for up to 30 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frde5","text":"Pooling of Libraries and dilution of the pool to 1 nM concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bvrda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"535m7","text":"Perform quantitation on each of the individual libaries. Qubit HS assay is recommended by Illumina, but a NanoDrop can be used if this is the only instrument available. Enter the results into Column B on the \"Normalization and Pooling\" tab in the \"DNA Flex Workbook\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":192,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ep2i5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ak278","text":"NOTE:This procedure assumes that all input DNA is \u003e100 ng and therefore would yield a stable library. Nextera DNA Flex library preparation method produces normalized libraries and does not require a dilution-based normalization step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":5,"length":228}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2nqn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ea9qr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9itd","text":"Pool 5 μL per sample into a single 1.5ml tube. Optional: for smaller bacterial genomes, reduce the input volume to 2.5  μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4j9tb","text":"Mix by vortexing then spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pkn3","text":"Quantify the pooled library using the Qubit HS assay or NanoDrop. Record result at the bottom of the “Normalization and Pooling” tab in the “DNA Flex Workbook”. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evu93","text":"This SOP uses the CFSAN suggested conversion factor of 2.5 which assumes an average fragment size of roughly 600 bp. The “DNA Flex Workbook” will convert the final pooled library input to nM using this conversion factor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a32r8","text":"The “DNA Flex Workbook” will then calculate the values necessary to dilute your library to a concentration of 4 nM in a volume of 15 µL (C1V1 = C2V2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84p5l","text":"Dilute the final library to 4 nM according to the values on the workbook using RSB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"72ft4","text":"Add 5 µl of the 4 nM pool to 15 µL RSB to a new low bind microtube to make 1 nM pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5bdgb","text":"Vortex briefly, and then quick-spin at 280 x g for 3 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"337qn","text":"Set aside 1 nM library on ice or this is a safe stopping point. The 1 nM library can be stored at -20ºC for up to 1 month. Stopping at this point will also allow for thawing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dir1e","text":"Preparation of Cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ebbpd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"de6ef","text":"Wear powder-free gloves.Thaw by following one of three ways listed below. Prior to thawing, remove the cartridge from the box but do not open the white foil bag! After thawing, do not refreeze. Store cartridge at -15˚C to -25˚C at least one day before thawing using any of the methods listed below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ll52","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c3ur4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5btoh","text":"If cartridge is wet from a water bath, dry with paper towels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":" "},"B_1":{"className":" "},"C_1":{"className":" "},"C_2":{"className":" "},"C_3":{"className":" "},"C_4":{"className":" "}},"colTitles":["Method","Thaw time","Instruction"],"colWidths":["116","139","355"],"data":[["20˚C to 25˚C water bath","6 hours, not exceeding 18 hours","Use 6  L water per cartridge.  Set a  temperature-controlled water bath to 25˚C or mix hot and cold water to  achieve 20˚C to 25˚C. Face the bag label up, submerge the cartridge completely,  and apply ~2 kg weight to prevent floating. Do not stack cartridges in the  water bath unless it is temperature-controlled."],["2˚C to 8˚C refrigerator","36 hours, not exceeding 1 week","Position the cartridge so that the label faces up and air can circulate on all sides, including the bottom."],["Room-temperature air (20˚C to 25˚C)","9 hours, not exceeding 18 hours","Position the cartridge so that the label faces up and air can circulate on all sides, including the bottom."]],"guid":"C1A1F750D8BC11EA8A05B3B72999ADFB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["20˚C to 25˚C water bath","6 hours, not exceeding 18 hours","Use 6  L water per cartridge.  Set a  temperature-controlled water bath to 25˚C or mix hot and cold water to  achieve 20˚C to 25˚C. Face the bag label up, submerge the cartridge completely,  and apply ~2 kg weight to prevent floating. Do not stack cartridges in the  water bath unless it is temperature-controlled."],["2˚C to 8˚C refrigerator","36 hours, not exceeding 1 week","Position the cartridge so that the label faces up and air can circulate on all sides, including the bottom."],["Room-temperature air (20˚C to 25˚C)","9 hours, not exceeding 18 hours","Position the cartridge so that the label faces up and air can circulate on all sides, including the bottom."]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vc7o","text":"Dilute Pool to 200 pM Loading Concentration for iSeq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8auku","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bev7q","text":"Add 20 µL of 1 nM pool to 80 µl of RSB to a new low bind microtube to produce 100 µL of 200 pM concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4vl1a","text":"Vortex briefly, and then centrifuge at 280 x g for 3 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nour","text":"Spiking of Library with PhiX.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2de4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"94tu7","text":"Add 2 µL of 10 nM PhiX to 18 µL of RSB in a new low bind microtube to make 1 nM PhiX. PhiX can be safely stored at -20°C for up to one month at this concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38slm","text":"Vortex briefly, and then centrifuge at 280 x g for 3 sec. Set aside on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80rcc","text":"Further dilute the PhiX in a low bind microtube to 200 pM by adding 20 µL of 1 nM PhiX to 80 µL of RSB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ao57h","text":"Vortex briefly, and then centrifuge at 280 x g for 3 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3agte","text":"Add 2 µL of 200 pM PhiX to the tube that contains 100 µL of 200 pM pooled library. (These volumes result in a ~2% PhiX spike-in. Actual percentage varies depending on library quality and quantity).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3f5q8","text":"Set aside the library with PhiX spike-in on ice. This is the final loading product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a58i3","text":"Load the Flow Cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10crn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54omr","text":"Avoiding the access window on top of the cartridge, remove the cartridge from the bag. Discard the bag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgg3a","text":"Invert the cartridge five times to mix reagents. Internal components can rattle during inversion, which is normal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d5q6","text":"Tap the cartridge (label facing up) on the bench or other hard surface five times to ensure reagent aspiration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6akc0","text":"Using a new pipette tip, pierce the Library reservoir and push the foil to the edges to enlarge the hole. Discard the pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87ni8","text":"Add 20 µL diluted library to the bottom of the reservoir. Avoid touching the foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ddgi","text":"Open the white foil package containing the flow cell from the notches. Use within 24 hours of opening.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bs8e","text":"Carefully pull the flow cell out of the package. Touch only the plastic when handling the flow cell. Avoid touching the electrical interface, CMOS sensor, glass, and gaskets on either side of the glass. See the referenced iSeq guide for an illustration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3c2mb","text":"Hold the flow cell by the grip points with the label facing up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pv6q","text":"Insert the flow cell into the slot on the front of the cartridge. An audible click indicates that the flow cell is in place. When properly loaded, the grip protrudes from the cartridge and the glass is visible from the access window.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4en2h","text":"Set Up a Sequencing Run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"arb8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a3n3d","text":"From the control software menu, select Local Run Manager, and then select Open Local Run Manager.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c15ei","text":"Select + Create Run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7ai3","text":"From the three available options, select Generate FASTQ.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":41,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aati5","text":"Enter Run Name in this format: YYMMDD-Vet-LIRN-LAB [“LAB” is your two-letter state abbreviation listed in Appendix B.] [Example, for a run starting on November 27, 2019 the run name would be entered as 191127-Vet-LIRN-NY].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31n7o","text":"Enter Run Description (e.g. \"Practice Samples\").","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79c0","text":"Under Run Settings, select the appropriate Library Prep Kit (Nextera DNA CD Indexes-24 index tube.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4hu5p","text":"Index Reads, select the box next to “2.”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bflo","text":"Read Type, select Paired End.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e33hr","text":"Read Lengths, be sure that 151 has been entered for Read 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7euio","text":"Read Lengths, be sure that 151 has been entered for Read 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3l5r","text":"Under Module-Specific Settings, be sure the Adapter Trimming option “On” is selected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1eroe","text":"For each sample being sequenced, enter the Sample ID, Sample Description, and Sample Project. Do not modify the Sample ID, Sample Description, and Sample Project. It must be entered exactly as given below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":127}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cf8mk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ovr1","text":"The Sample ID is the same as the Isolate ID listed in Column B of the Initial Dilution Tab of the Flex workbook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2g8v6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qd2b","text":"Sample Description is the same as the Organism in Column C of the Initial Dilution Tab of the Flex workbook. If labeling with genus and species a “-“ must be included between the Genus and Species because the sequencer software does not recognize spaces.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6p107","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rml8","text":"For the Vet-LIRN iSeq study: The Sample Project name is: VL-iSeq-LAB, where “LAB” is your two-letter state abbreviation. Do not deviate from this naming format.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qvkn","text":"Under INDEX plate location using the dropdown.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6tk9v","text":"Save the run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d82h2","text":"In the control software, select Sequence from the Home screen. The software opens the door at an angle, ejects the tray, and initiates the series of run setup screens.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ju0p","text":"Load the Cartridge onto the Instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a9mqm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2i4du","text":"Place the cartridge onto the tray so that the access window faces up and the flow cell is inside the instrument. Do not push the cartridge or tray into the instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"697ne","text":"Select Close Door to retract the cartridge and close the door. A panel appears on the left side of the screen to show information from the scanned consumables. During scanning, you can continue with run setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f34di","text":"Sign in to BaseSpace Sequence Hub.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bvmik","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bi3k8","text":"Sign in to your BaseSpace Sequence Hub by entering your email address and password, and then select Sign In.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":100,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ohl4","text":"Under configurations, make sure that “run monitoring and storage” has been checked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"allbp","text":"Select Run Setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqs30","text":"Select a Run and Review Pre-Run Checks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"adnjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"boc2e","text":"Select the run you saved (from step 170 above) from the Run Name list.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2tsrm","text":"Select Start Run to start the pre-run check.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpk6k","text":"Wait about 15 minutes for pre-run checks to complete. The run will start automatically after successful completion. Do not open the door during the pre-run check or during the run because it can cause run failure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rnar","text":"If an error occurs during the instrument check, select Retry to redo the check.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9o04","text":"Unload Consumables.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2tqj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"523t8","text":"When sequencing is complete, select Eject Cartridge. The software ejects the used cartridge from the instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2u7lp","text":"Remove the cartridge from the tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"vut7","text":"Remove the flow cell from the cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2gjk","text":"Dispose of the flow cell, which has electronic components, in accordance with applicable standards for your institution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ir60","text":"Dispose of the cartridge, which contains used reagents, in accordance with applicable standards for your institution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8i5sa","text":"Select Close Door to reload the tray and return to the Home screen. The software automatically reloads the tray and sensors confirm the cartridge removal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":7,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f37dn","text":"Share the Run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ut4l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ele42","text":"Sign in to BaseSpace on a web browser and check that the run is complete.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70qms","text":"Click on the run name. Select “Share”, enter the email of the person you would like to share with, and make sure that the check box for sharing the project remains clicked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
